txt.en: Return to Gerja
You found Danakh-khêj park!
DNT - Search for the park
Explore the park
Empty, crumbling benches line the paths of the Danakh-khêj park.

DNT - 'Do not be deceived by the current conditions of Clovengap. Ancient records state that this area was once tiered gardens, markets, and parks. The author of said records wrote of vineyards, lush fields for livestock, and gardens of fruit bearing trees, herbs, and ornamental plants.

This dwarf-made memorial stone is weathered but has stood strong against time and the elements. The runes read, 'Rest well, Azagh Gamz, my fierce warrior.'\n\nBeneath the runes is a small, carved, paw-print.
Explore the park
DNT - The fountains of Danakh-khêj still flow

'So the fountains still flow? Ah, my mind wanders to what it must have been like. Dwarves of all ages, relaxing and enjoying the day, chatting together on the benches, the fountains splashing merrily. We shall return it to its glory, my friend.'
Gerja Defthand is in north-east Clovengap.\n\nYou should let Gerja Defthand know what you found in the park.
Danakh-khêj is in northern Clovengap.\n\nYou should search for the ruins of the Danakh-khêj park.
Benches are scattered about the park
'Have you found more locations?'
Danakh-khêj is in northern Clovengap.\n\nYou should explore Danakh-khêj park.
The fountains of Danakh-khêj still flow!
The Broken Benches of Danakh-khêj

This dwarf-made memorial stone is weathered but has stood strong against time and the elements. The runes read, 'Rest well, Azagh Gamz, my fierce warrior.'\n\nBeneath the runes is a small, carved, paw-print.

'You found the vineyards! I can see them from here, now that you point out the direction. Oh how I wish I could be down among those arches!

'I hear you did much to help clear them of sabre-tooth cats! Thank you, thank you ever so much!

'The next location to find is Danakh-khêj. One of my ancient texts contains part of a song about meeting a beloved in a lush sward of grass under the mountain, the two gazing at the stars together. Should you find an enormous fountain, you shall know you are in the right place.'
DNT - An eager architect asks assistance acquiring details of Clovengap.
Search for the park
